Instructor: Sam Pimentel spi@berkeley.edu Office hours:  - Wednesday 11am-12pm, Evans 429  - Thursday 12pm-1pm, Evans 429

title: Statistics 135: Concepts of Statistics
text:
Ed

  DataHub

  Gradescope


No matching items


Statistics 135 is a comprehensive survey course in statistical theory and methodology. Topics include parameter estimation, hypothesis testing, statistical tests (parametric and nonparametric) and linear regression (single and multiple). We will cover most of chapters 7,8,9,11,12,13 and 14 in the textbook, Mathematical Statistics and Data Analysis, Third Edition, by John A. Rice.
